sen.j: 善阿（ぜんな、生没年不詳）は、鎌倉時代後期の僧・連歌師。
sen.e: Zenna (善阿) (years of birth and death are unknown) is a Buddhist monk and a Rengashi (linked-verse poet).
Zenna (善阿) (years of birth and death are unknown) was a Buddhist monk and a Rengashi (linked-verse poet).
Zenna (years of birth and death are unknown) was a Buddhist monk and a Rengashi (linked-verse poet) from the end of Kamakura Period.
sen.cmt: 漢字は不要かと思います。「from the end of Kamakura Period.」を追記しました。

sen.j: 京都七条道場金光寺 (京都市)（時宗）の僧と伝えられる。
sen.e: It is said that he was a Buddhist monk of Konko-ji Temple, Kyoto Shichijo dojo (Kyoto City) (Tokimune).
It is said that he was a Buddhist monk of Konko-ji Temple, Kyoto Shichijo dojo (Kyoto City) (Tokimune).
It is said that he was a Buddhist monk of Konko-ji Temple, Kyoto Shichijo dojo Training Hall (Kyoto City) (Jishu sect).
sen.cmt: 「Shichijo dojo」→「Shichijo dojo Training Hall」「Tokimune」→「Jishu sect」としました。

sen.j: 救済 (連歌師)（ぐさい）・順覚などの地下（じげ）の連歌師の指導者であったようである。
sen.e: He seems to have been a leader of the Jige Rengashi (linked-verse poets of lower class nobles) such as Gusai (Rengashi) and Junkaku.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。文末は、「で、」→「である。」に変更しました。
sen.e: He seems to have been a leader of the Jige Rengashi (linked-verse poets of lower class nobles) such as Gusai (Rengashi) and Junkaku.
He seems to have been a leader of the Jige Rengashi (linked-verse poets of lower class nobles) such as Gusai (Rengashi) and Junkaku.

sen.j: 准勅撰集「莵玖波集」に多くの句が入集するなど当時名声を集めていた。
sen.e: At that time, he was gaining a high reputation, and many of his poems were chosen for the associate anthology of poems collected by Imperial Command (Junchokusenshu) named 'Tokubashu' (Tokuba Collection).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。「莵玖波集」→'Tokubashu' (Tokuba Collection) [http://books.google.com/books?isbn=0313254869]。 なお、「莵玖波集」は書名なので『』に入れ、英文は、"Tokubashu"としたほうが良いかもしれません。
sen.e: At that time, he was gaining a high reputation, and many of his poems were chosen for the associate anthology of poems collected by Imperial Command (Junchokusenshu) named 'Tokubashu' (Tokuba Collection).

At that time, he was gaining a high reputation, and many of his poems were chosen for Junchokusenshu (the associate anthology of poems collected by Imperial Command) named 'Tokubashu' (Tokuba Collection).
sen.cmt: 「the associate anthology of poems collected by Imperial Command (Junchokusenshu)」→「Junchokusenshu (the associate anthology of poems collected by Imperial Command)」としました。

sen.j: 「連歌本式」と呼ばれる連歌式目の制定にもかかわっていた。
sen.e: He was also involved in formulating the code of Renga poem called 'Renga honshiki' (full-scale Renga formulary).
He was also involved in formulating the code of Renga poems called 'Renga honshiki' (full-scale Renga formulary).
He was also involved in formulating the code of Renga poems called 'Renga honshiki' (full-scale Renga formulary).

sen.j: 善阿の句風は「万葉集」を基調としていたことから古風と評され、次の時代の連歌師指導者で門弟であった救済には受け入れられなかった。
sen.e: Zenna's verse style, which followed the theme of 'Manyoshu' (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves), was considered old-fashioned, and Gusai, his disciple and a leader of the next generation's Renga poets, did not acknowledge it.
sen.cmt: 「万葉集」は書名なので『』に入れ、英文は、"Manyoshu"としたほうが良いかもしれません。
